Does the CI / PI hold a current ICH GCP certification?
Please upload current ICH GCP certification

ICH GCP training and certification is available here:
https://globalhealthtrainingcentre.tghn.org/ich-good-clinical-practice
Register and go to eLearning courses, short courses, and select 'ICH Good Clinical Practice E6 (R2)'. This will take on average 45- 60 minutes to complete. A certificate is issued once a minimum of 80% is achieved in the final quiz section. Certification is valid for 3 years from the date of completion. You can download and print your certificate for your files. This training is provided courtesy of The Global Health Network: www.theglobalhealthnetwork.org

Has an independent Data Safety Monitoring Committee (DSMC/DSMB) been established?

An independent DSMC is required if the study is intended to provide information about effectiveness and/or safety of an intervention. Phase II and III studies require a DSMC with the exception of low risk behavioural and nutritional studies unless the study is particularly large, long term and or involves vulnerable subjects.
Please visit this link for further information.

Does the study involve the provision of an intervention?
Does the study involve the use of an Investigational Product (IP) or Device?

The Investigational Product (IP) includes any product, or intervention or diagnostic being investigated, tested or used as a placebo or reference point in a clinical trial. This includes use in a different formulation or unapproved indication, or when used to gain further information about an approved use.

Australian based manufacturers of medicines and biologicals are required to hold a licence to manufacture.To obtain a licence, a manufacturer must demonstrate compliance with the relevant code of GMP. Overseas manufacturers of medicines supplied to Australia are also required to meet an acceptable standard of GMP. It is an offence in Australia to manufacture therapeutic goods for human use without a licence or certification unless the manufacturer is exempt from this requirement under the Therapeutic Goods Act 1989.
Is the trial intervention registered with the TGA?

Sponsors must be aware of the requirements to import, export, manufacture and supply 'unapproved' therapeutic goods/devices in Australia. For clinical trials, the following avenues are available: Clinical Trial Notification (CTN) scheme. Sponsor must notify TGA of the intent to use an 'unapproved' therapeutic good prior to use. Notification is submitted online. Fee applies. Clinical Trial Exemption (CTX) scheme. Sponsor must submit application to the TGA if intending to use unapproved high risk or novel treatments such as class 4 biologicals. For details go to: https://www.tga.gov.au/sme-assist/which-clinical-trial-scheme-should-i-choose#1
Has the clinical study been registered on a Clinical Trial Registry?

The Declaration of Helsinki, now explicitly states that every clinical trial must be registered in a publicly accessible database before recruitment of the first subject. Eg.ANZCTR: https://anzctr.org.au/
It is highly recommended that ALL research is registered if you are intending to publish in an International Committee of Medical Journal Editors (ICMJE) Journal.

field_label:
What type of information data is being stored?

e.g. patient list, numeric or text results

Does any of the data contain personal (identifiable) information?

Personal information contains details about an identified individual or one who is reasonably identifiable, such as name, phone number, and address.

This applies to participants, staff, volunteers, among others.

If you are storing personal information, you should have specific consent from the individual for it to be held in your data base. The European Union General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) stipulates this as an absolute requirement and a breach is subject to considerable fines.
For more information go to: bit.ly/2WWk6yJ
Do you have ethics approval to hold this personal (identifiable) information?
If you are holding any personal information for patients/participants you must have specific ethics approval for the collection and storage of personal information.
What data base(s) are you using to store the data?

The Florey have a REDCap platform with existing expertise in the building and maintenance of clinical study data bases from small to very large complex designs.

If you would like to know more about the possibility of using REDCap through the Florey platform,
please contact redcap-admin@florey.edu.au for further information.
